result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew S Platz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month, starting 07-01-2015, alternate 51 days Jail if not paid.
Blood Test Reimbursement:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha Circuit Court to be forwarded to the Town of Mukwonago Police Department.

TIME SERVED.
Huber with standard release conditions.
Credit For Time Served 233 Days.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Defendant to attend Victim Impact Panel Meeting on June 17, 2015.  Defendant to serve 30 days Huber, Consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel Meeting.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andrew S Platz in court with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1. State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Masnica makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

233 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 233 days)  **TIME SERVED**

DL REVOCATION:  36 MONTHS
IGNITION INTERLOCK:  36 MONTHS

**DNA sample to be provided ifnot yet previously done 

**Attned Victim Impoact Panel on:  6/17/15.  Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel

FINE:  $2,277.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 7/1/15, alternate 51 days jail if not paid)

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 (to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Town of Mukwonago Police Department)
Filed by Atty Manica.

Defendant Andrew S Platz in court with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant only to be released during business hours and have SCRAM installed immediately. MODIFIED CONDITION: Defendant allowed Huber Bailee status. NOTE: $25,000.00 signature bond also required.

Defendant Andrew S Platz in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. Information filed, reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Court hears defense bail motion. Attorney Masnica is requesting a reduction in bail and that defendant be granted huber bailee status. State has no objection to huber release, but requests cash bail remain. Court grants motion to modify bail, but denies request for huber bailee status.
Preliminary hearing on October 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
